passage_text: What is Mid-Century Modern? What is Mid-Century Modern? Mid-Century modern is an architectural, interior and product design form that generally describes mid-20th century development in modern design, architecture and urban development from roughly 1933 to the late 1960s (www.en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mid-century-modern).

Colors. In addition to clean, spare design, mid-century modern furniture makes use of vivid colors like red, yellow, blue, or green, combined with black or white. Clean Lines, Open Spaces: A View of Mid-Century Modern Architecture. Clean Lines, Open Spaces: A View of Mid-Century Modern Architecture received three Emmy awards in the 2012 annual awards competition of the Mid-America Chapter of the National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences. The film was honored for Best Cultural Documentary, Best Writing and Best Editing.

Materials. Mid-century modern furniture does not usually use the types of wood traditionally seen in household furniture. Instead, mid-century designers preferred to use unique man-made materials such as fiberglass and plastics like Bakelite, Plexiglas, and Lucite.Teak wood also became very popular.olors. In addition to clean, spare design, mid-century modern furniture makes use of vivid colors like red, yellow, blue, or green, combined with black or white. Through the colors they used, mid-century designers expressed their desire for hope and peace in the world.

Understanding Mid-Century Modern Homes. The history of Mid-Century Modern design in America begins when radically new architectural trends in Germany grew to prominence after World War I and II. The political climate at the time would push architects to the United States seeking opportunity and advancement.

Clean Lines, Open Spaces: A View of Mid-Century Modern Architecture focuses on the construction boom in the United States after World War II. Sometimes considered cold and unattractive, mid-century modern designs were a by-product of post-war optimism and reflected a nation's dedication to building a new future.
